thread.title: TJX: Strong Q4 Earnings Make It A ‘Retail Dream’
thread.title_full: TJX: Strong Q4 Earnings Make It A ‘Retail Dream’ - Stocks to Watch - Barrons.com

author: Teresa Rivas
title: TJX: Strong Q4 Earnings Make It A ‘Retail Dream’
text:
By Teresa Rivas TJX Cos . ( TJX ) is down slightly Wednesday, giving up the early gains from its fourth-quarter earnings .
Getty Images The off-price retailer said that it earned $1.03 per share, above the $1 analysts were expecting. Revenues rose 6% $9.47 billion, also above the $9.44 billion consensus. Same-store sales rose 3% in the quarter.
For the full year, TJX said it expects to earn between $3.69 and $3.78 a share, below the $3.79 analysts are modeling.
The company said that it also expects to buy back between $1.3 billion and $1.8 billion of its stock during the current fiscal year, with the board adding $1 billion to its repurchase program, and it said it plans to raise its dividend.
Cowen & Co.’s Oliver Chen reiterated an Outperform rating and $87 price target on the stock following the news, calling the company’s solid traffic and merchandise margins a “retail dream.” From his note:
TJX’s impressive execution drove 4Q EPS upside ($1.03 vs. St. $1.00), driven by better comps (+3% vs. St. +2.6%) & better-vs-expected GM (-40bp vs. Street est. -50bp). Importantly, comp was healthily driven by traffic, and merch. margin was up significantly. 1Q EPS guide is light, but conservatism could be a factor.
The shares are down 0.2% to $76.07.
